Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend the movie "The Interview" (2014) based on its connection with serial killers.
"The Interview" is a comedy film that revolves around Dave Skylark and his producer Aaron Rapaport who run the celebrity tabloid show "Skylark Tonight".
While they are working as usual, they land an interview with a surprise fan. However, things take a darker turn when they discover that their interviewee has died upon completion of a 30 second 200- meter race.
In the aftermath of this tragic event, Dave and Aaron find themselves recruited by the CIA to assassinate their interviewee's killer, Jong-Un Kim, who is responsible for the death of their interviewee.
Throughout the course of this intense and high-stakes mission, Dave and Aaron must navigate a web of deceit, manipulation, and intrigue as they work to bring down the reign of terror that has been carried out by Jong-Un Kim.

Based on your preferences for sound and law, here are a few recommendations from this list:

- Title: Disclosure (1994) | Plot: In 1975 and 1976 Paul McCartney and Wings undertook the epic Wings over the World tour, the largest scale tour they would ever undertake as a band. From this tour came both the legendary "Wings over America" triple live album and the concert film "Rockshow". Although filmed on this tour at the enormous Kingdome in Seattle, "Rockshow", originally a cut down version of the concert, was not premiered until November 1980 in New York and April 1981 in London. It was released on Betamax and later on laserdisc.
